SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Actor
Actor abstract class implements SuperInterface This class represents an actor in a concurrent system.
ActorContext
The ActorContext class is responsible for managing the lifecycle of actors, including spawning and looking up actors.
ActorDecorator
Abstract class that represents a decorator for the Actor class.
ActorListener
The ActorListener interface is used to define the behavior of an object that listens for events from an Actor.
ActorProxy
The ActorProxy class extends the Proxy class and serves as a proxy for an Actor.
AddActorDialog
The AddActorDialog class is a JDialog that allows the user to add new actors to the system.
AddClosureMessage
The AddClosureMessage class is a type of Message that is used to add a closure to the actor system.
AddInsultMessage
The AddInsultMessage class represents a message that adds an insult to a collection of insults.
Controller
The Controller class provides the functionality for controlling the behavior of Actors.
DynamicProxy
This class implements the InvocationHandler interface and serves as a dynamic proxy for the target object.
EncryptionDecorator
EncryptionDecorator class is a decorator class that encrypts and decrypts messages sent and received by the actor it decorates.
Event
The Event class represents an event that occurs in the Actor system.
EventType
Enumeration of different event types that can occur in an Actor system.
FirewallDecorator
The FirewallDecorator class is an implementation of the ActorDecorator class.
FirewallLambdaDecorator
This class is a decorator that allows to apply a firewall based on Lambda expressions.
GetAllInsultsMessage
The GetAllInsultsMessage class is a child class of Message class.
GetInsultMessage
GetInsultMessage class is a message class that extends the Message class.
HelloWorldActor
HelloWorldActor class extends Actor This class represents an actor that prints a message to the console.
InInsultService
The InInsultService interface defines the methods that must be implemented by classes that provide functionality for managing insults.
InsultActor
The class InsultActor is a class that extends the Actor class and represents an Actor that can generate insults.
InsultMe
The InsultMe class extends the Message class and is used to request an insult from a sender.
InsultService
The class InsultService implements the InInsultService interface and provides methods to add, get, and get all insults.
ListenerButton
The ListenerButton class is an implementation of the ActionListener interface, which is used to handle button clicks in the user interface.
Main
 
MainFramework
The MainFramework class is the entry point of the application.
MainTest
MainTest class contains a set of tests that check the functionality of the actors and decorators in the system.
Message
Class representing a message that can be sent between instances of SuperInterface (actors and proxy).
MessDialog
The MessDialog class is a subclass of JDialog and displays a dialog box that shows the received messages of a selected actor.
MonitorService
The MonitorService class is used to monitor the activity of actors in a system.
MonitorTest
This class MonitorTest implements the interface ActorListener and is used to monitor actors.
PingPongActor
The PingPongActor class is a subclass of the Actor class.
PingPongDialog
The class PingPongDialog extends JDialog and allows the user to select two actors from the list of available actors, and sends a ping-pong message between them by using the controller's TestPingPong method.
Proxy
The abstract class Proxy is the foundation of the proxy design pattern.
Publisher
This class represents a publisher, which can hold a list of observers (ActorListeners) and notify them of events.
QueueDialog
This class creates a dialog for viewing the current state of a queue.
QuitMessage
Class representing a QuitMessage which is a type of Message.
ReflectiveActor
The ReflectiveActor class is an extension of the Actor class, that allows for the execution of methods on a given object, using reflection.
ReplyMessage
The ReplyMessage class is a subclass of the Message class and represents a message sent in response to another message.
Ring
This class represents a ring, which links a list of RingActors in a circular fashion.
RingActor
The RingActor class is an implementation of the Actor class that represents a ring of actors, where messages are passed along in a circular fashion.
RingDialog
RingDialog is a JDialog class that allows the user to select a list of names from a provided list and then starts the ring using the selected names.
Runner
The Runner class is a thread that runs the Actor and notifies the Publisher of events that occur while processing messages.
SuperInterface
SuperInterface is an interface that defines send and getName methods.
TalkDialog
The TalkDialog class extends JDialog and is used to display a dialog box with options to select names and send messages.
TestPingPong
TestPingPong class is used to test the functionality of the PingPongActor class.
TestRingActor
The class TestRingActor runs a test for a ring of RingActor objects.
Vista
The Vista class is a JFrame extension that provides the user interface for the Actors model.
